item.title: 12 Best Horror Games Set On A Farm
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games set on farms create a sense of seclusion and vulnerability for players to experience.
  • Greyhill Incident offers a refreshing alien invasion narrative in the survival horror genre.
  • Stay Out of the House provides a gory and complex slasher experience perfect for fans of the genre.

Forests and abandoned buildings are some of the most utilized settings for horror games. It's not without good reason - the shadowy trees and tight, maze-like corridors make for some truly terrifying encounters. However, it also means that many gamers overlook titles set in less common environments.

Farms have the potential to be among the creepiest backdrops for horror games. Picture an isolated farmhouse with no neighbors for miles, leaving players all alone and exposed to killers, or thick corn fields that obscure whatever sinister presence might be lurking outside. These are some of the best horror games set on a farm that leave players feeling secluded and vulnerable.

This list includes games both entirely set on farms and those with farm levels or maps.

1 Greyhill Incident

One Man And His Revolver Vs. An Alien Invasion

Greyhill Incident
Adventure
Horror
Systems
Released
July 9, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Refugium Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

In a time when the supernatural and monsters dominate the horror genre, a good old classic alien invasion narrative is refreshing. Greyhill Incident is a survival horror game based on 90s America's extraterrestrial conspiracy craze.

Players must make their way through a rural village to save their neighbors while avoiding being abducted. While it has been criticized for its AI, pacing, and voice acting, Greyhill Incident is a hilarious yet atmospheric experience when not taken too seriously.

2 Pomberito

A South American Folklore-Inspired Farming Sim

Pomberito
Horror
First-Person
Mystery
Systems
Released
June 25, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Lara the Pitbull
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

In Guaraní folklore, the "Pomberito" is believed to be a short humanoid being that inhabits rural areas, causing mischief and inconveniencing farmers. Pomberito is a farming simulator set in Argentina's countryside, taking inspiration from this mythology.

Over five nights, players must complete tasks, but soon discover they are not alone; the Pomberito is roaming the fields, and the player must catch it. While the game involves a lot of walking and fetching, it's a fun little title that easily catches players off guard with the creature sprinting out of the darkness.

3 Tales Beyond The Tomb: The Farm's Secret

Play Out A Disturbing True Story

  • Platforms: Windows
  • Release Date: December 22, 2024
  • Developer: 616 Games

Sometimes, real life is scarier than the outlandish scenarios seen in a lot of horror media. Tales Beyond the Tomb is an episodic horror which, similar to Fears to Fathom , takes inspiration from true stories, allowing players to experience the terrifying ordeals of those who experienced them.

The Farm's Secret is the second episode of the series, following a young woman, Samantha, who is caught in a terrible circumstance; players must take risks if they want to help her escape. For a walking simulator, the title is very tense, which is made all the more unnerving by its PS1-era aesthetic.

4 AM

An Innovative Driving Horror Game

  • Platforms: Windows
  • Release Date: March 1, 2025
  • Developer: BrocBois

Usually, horror games place players in eerie settings with limited resources to make them feel helpless. AM at first seems to deviate from these tropes, allowing players to speed around in a car. However, it soon becomes apparent that not even the vehicle's interior is safe from the evil outside.

AM' s world feels lonely, disorienting, and liminal as players gradually discover the scope of the horrors that await them on the backroads. The game has some unique mechanics; players can use their headlights, radio, and torch to their advantage. To make what is essentially a driving simulator both engaging and scary is an impressive feat.

At the time of writing, AM is still in its demo phase, but it is still a lengthy experience with significant replay value.

5 Stay Out Of The House

The Perfect Nostalgia Bait For Slasher Fans

Stay Out of the House
Survival Horror
Simulation
Stealth
Systems
Released
October 14, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Puppet Combo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Puppet Combo is known in the indie horror community for its PS1/VHS-style titles. Drawing inspiration from 80s slashers, many of Puppet Combo's games are especially gory, and Stay Out of the House is no exception.

Players control Roxanne, a young woman who has been abducted by "The Butcher," a serial killer who has turned his rural home into a slaughterhouse for humans. Complete with tense chase scenes, gruesome environments, and a more complex plot than is first let on, Stay Out of the House is a great indie game and a must-play for fans of The Texas Chain Saw Massacre .

6 Pacify (Farm)

Team Up And Capture The Paranormal

Pacify
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
February 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Shawn Hitchcock
Publisher(s)
Hitchcock Games
Multiplayer
Online Co-Op
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

There is no shortage of co-op ghost and monster-hunting games, though Pacify stands out as one of the games that brought attention to the genre. As part of Paranormal Activity Helpers Incorporated, players (alone or as a team) must find and capture entities across various locations.

"Farm" is one of the maps in Pacify , where players must find a way to restrain the insatiably hungry farmer without being caught (and eaten). The dark grounds that span from the farmhouse to a cemetery are eerie and make for some real scares.

7 We Harvest Shadows

A Beautifully Moody And Story-Rich Farming Sim

We Harvest Shadows
First-Person
Horror
Farming
Simulation
Systems
Developer(s)
David Wehle

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
Steam
Powered by

We Harvest Shadows is a stunning farming sim with an unexpected twist. Players take on the role of Garett, who is suffering from depression and has decided to lock himself away from the rest of the world to live alone on a farm. With a daily to-do list, they are kept busy until things start to go awry.

The game is a slow burn, which works well for building tension; players will get invested in upgrading the farm only to gradually realize things aren't as they should be. It's an intriguing exploration of mental health and isolation, and a great psychological horror that will leave players wondering what is real.

8 The Texas Chain Saw Massacre

Kill Or Be Killed, Slaughterhouse Style

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
7 /10
7.0 /10
Released
August 18, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Sumo Nottingham
Publisher(s)
Gun Interactive
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Franchise
The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
Powered by

Slasher movies came to define the 70s and 80s. While Halloween is often considered the franchise that brought the subgenre into the mainstream, The Texas Chain Saw Massacre was a significant influence. In 2023, Sumo Nottingham gave the title a new lease of life in video game format.

As an asymmetrical horror game, players can control one of the iconic cannibal Sawyer family members, hunting down their next meal, or a survivor attempting to avoid such a demise. While somewhat limited in comparison to some other titles of the same ilk, TTCM pays homage to the grim Southern Gothic atmosphere of the films.

9 Dead By Daylight (Coldwind Farm)

Escape A Roster Of Relentless Killers

Dead by Daylight
21
8.5 /10
Released
June 14, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Behaviour Interactive
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Franchise
Dead by Daylight
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia, Switch, Mobile
Powered by

Despite being almost a decade old, Dead by Daylight is still being continuously updated, giving it a longevity that many other asymmetrical horror games fail to achieve. With an ever-expanding roster of original and licensed killers and survivors, seasonal events, and diverse playstyle options, it's a title that players keep returning to.

"Coldwind Farm" is one of the realms in Dead by Daylight , complete with six maps. The farm is associated with "The Hilbilly" - a disfigured chainsaw-wielding killer. While it has its funny moments playing with friends, being chased down by a power tool enthusiast is a hair-raising experience.

10 Phasmophobia (Bleasdale/Grafton Farmhouse)

Ghost-Hunting Has Never Been So Deadly

Phasmophobia
10.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Kinetic Games
Multiplayer
Online Co-Op
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Phasmophobia very quickly became a success, in part because of its pandemic release and the coinciding rise in streaming, but largely because of its fun (and terrifying) gameplay. Players are tasked with finding and recording evidence of the supernatural for ghost-removers. Unfortunately, it's not a risk-free job, and there's no guarantee they will make it out alive.

Phasmaphobia has ample map and ghost variety, as well as different difficulty modes, keeping each game fresh. Players can also use their mic to use some of the ghost-hunting equipment, but should be prepared for the responses that the paranormal has in store for them.

item.title: Monster Train 2 Reveals Content Roadmap
item.description:
Shiny Shoe has laid out the content roadmap for Monster Train 2 , loaded with free updates and a major expansion planned for later. The sequel to the hit indie deckbuilder was first announced back in February, at which point PC players also got access to a free Monster Train 2 demo on Steam.

That reveal was followed by an official release date announcement confirming that Monster Train 2 is launching on May 21 for PC, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X/S. Alongside that news came a new trailer that introduced the game’s central threat: the Titans, powerful enemies players will need to overcome to stop them from taking control of Heaven. The original Monster Train was a favorite among roguelike fans and pulled in solid reviews, so expectations for the follow-up were high from the start.

Since launch, Monster Train 2 has drawn a strong response, recently passing the milestone of 500,000 players. To mark the moment and keep that momentum going, Shiny Shoe has unveiled a roadmap that outlines what’s coming next. The first update, Lost Arsenal, is set for Q3 2025 and will be free. Monster Train 2 players can expect fresh cards for all clans, new clanless equipment and room cards, and rebalanced legacy cards, all of them designed to add more strategic variety and shake up the gameplay. This marks the beginning of a three-part post-launch update cycle.

Monster Train 2 Content Roadmap

The second Monster Train 2 update is coming in Q4 2025. It doesn’t have a name yet, but it’s expected to introduce new Void-based threats, tougher bosses, fresh gameplay mutators, strategic artifacts, and more cosmetics. Then in Q1 2026 comes the biggest update so far - a mix of free content and a major paid expansion. While details remain under wraps, it’ll feature a new game mode, a brand-new clan, and other significant additions. Each update for the deckbuilding roguelike game will also come with regular bug fixes, balance changes, and localization tweaks based on community feedback.

The newly revealed roadmap shows that Monster Train 2 has plenty lined up, building on an already well-received foundation. At the time of writing, the game is sitting at nearly 96% positive reviews on Steam. Its current concurrent player count is 18,503, noticeably higher than the original game’s all-time peak of 14,073 over more than five years. On top of that, the game has been making crossover moves too. Just this past May, Balatro announced a collaboration with Monster Train 2 .

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Final Fantasy 9 Fans Are Worried About Its 25th Anniversary
item.description:
As Final Fantasy 9 celebrated its 25th anniversary, fans took to social media to share concerns that Square Enix missed a major opportunity to share information about a potential remake of the beloved title. So far, Final Fantasy 9 has commemorated its 25th anniversary with various pieces of artwork and merchandise that fans can pre-order.

On July 7, 2000, Final Fantasy 9 was released in Japan for the original PlayStation console. After Final Fantasy 7 and Final Fantasy 8 took a modern turn, Final Fantasy 9 brought the franchise back to its medieval fantasy roots with its whimsical ensemble cast and colorful environments. Since the 2021 GeForce Now leaks listed a potential remake of Final Fantasy 9 , speculation and rumors have sparked discussions among Final Fantasy fans. The Final Fantasy 9 remake rumors gained momentum in the lead-up to the game's 25th anniversary, with Square Enix sharing new character art by original designer Toshiyuki Itahana.

Although Final Fantasy 9 continued that trend with artwork of the Iifa tree and the main cast, fans of the beloved JRPG expressed their worries about a missed opportunity. Following a new trailer made for Final Fantasy 9 's 25th anniversary and the announcement of new merchandise on the Square Enix store, users on the Final Fantasy subreddit pondered if that was all that the company would do to commemorate the occasion. In response, a Reddit user shared a post from the UK branch of Domino's Pizza on Facebook, which stated that Square Enix should "announce the remake already" in reference to FF9 's anniversary. So far, Square Enix has not revealed any information about Final Fantasy 9 's potential remake.

Final Fantasy 9 Fans Concerned About Missed Remake Announcement Opportunity

However, one of the items that fans can pre-order is a Final Fantasy 9 artbook that delves into the origins of Vivi, one of the game's main characters. According to previews posted on the Square Enix Store, Vivi got his name from his adopted grandfather, Quan, as the Roman numerals VI VI indicated that Vivi stood at 6'6" while standing on his tiptoes and with his Black Mage's hat fully straightened out. Pre-orders for the Final Fantasy 9 Picture Book are priced at $18, with a tentative release date of May 19, 2026.

At publication time, the day is only halfway through in Japan, so Final Fantasy 9 fans waiting for further word about a potential remake should not lose hope yet. Only time will tell if Square Enix has any surprises left in store for Final Fantasy 9 's 25th anniversary.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: How to Unlock and Beat Lagiacrus
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds is continuing the trend of reintroducing fan-favorite monsters into the modern era, similarly to Monster Hunter World and Monster Hunter Rise . One of the most recent additions to the game is a monster fans have been eager to see return.

Lagiacrus comes to Monster Hunter Wilds after a long hiatus, as players haven't seen this monster since Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate . Fans of this beloved monster and those who will be hunting it for the first time will have to adapt to its new fighting mechanics. It may even require hunters to get their feet wet in its natural habitat. Here is how to unlcok and beat Lagiacrus in Monster Hunter Wilds .

How to Unlock Lagiacrus in Monster Hunter Wilds

In order to begin hunting Lagiacrus, you must be at least HR 31 before accepting the quest from Erik in the Scarlet Forest base camp. That will start a linear mission that results in a capture quest for a High-Rank Lagiacrus. After completing it, you will have an optional quest available for a regular Lagiacrus hunt. It will randomly appear in the Scarlet Forest in either a regular or Tempered form. Upon discovering it in the wild, you can either hunt it when you see it in the open world or save it as an Investigation to pursue later.

How to Beat Lagiacrus in Monster Hunter Wilds

Lagiacrus is a classic leviathan monster from previous Monster Hunter games, meaning some moves will be familiar to those who have hunted this monster in the past. Its weaker attacks come in the form of quick linear chomping attacks, tail swipes, small lightning projectiles, and a hip-check that takes advantage of Lagiacrus' linear body type. When using weapons with perfect guards, evades, or parries, these are great moves to take advantage of. Offset attacks are also a great choice, as getting the advantage on this monster early before its larger moves come out can make the difference in a hunt.

As Lagiacrus becomes enraged, it will start to use its lightning attacks more often. Its two staple moves are a slithering attack and a lightning eruption that can deal massive damage if you're not careful. The slithering attack propels Lagiacrus forward in a straight line, knocking down anything in its path. How enraged it is will determine how many times Lagiacrus will do this attack in succession. The sequence of moves can even end in a smaller eruption attack that deals damage in a radius wherever it decides to end its slithering attack. Of all its moves, the eruption attacks are the deadliest. Lagiacrus tends to move around a lot when fighting, but it will slow things down right as it is about to do an eruption attack and curl into itself to release its energy. It can do a smaller scale eruption attack that damages targets within relatively close range of it and a larger attack that will emit three waves of electricity from its body that all land in scattered places from a much greater range.

To counter the slithering attacks, the best options are to either dive out of the way or use a perfect dodge move like Dual Blades or Bow make use of. Perfect guard attacks can be useful if Lagiacrus only does a slithering attack once, but will still leave you in a dangerous position if it decides to come back around. The same can be said for offset attacks, unless you manage to engage in a power clash by doing so, which is not always guaranteed. Setting traps in the path of these attacks can be a great way to stop Lagiacrus' momentum and give you a good opening. To counter the eruption attacks, it is best to keep a safe distance and wait for the damage sequence to be over. Perfect guarding can prevent initial damage, but can lock you into a staggered guard state that can severely decrease your stamina meter and still do damage to you as the following lightning strikes hit. The safest strategy against these attacks is to wait for them to end before attacking, as there is a decent window where Lagiacrus will recover before attacking again. Specifically, after the larger eruption attack, Lagiacrus will have a temporary wound on its back that you can use a Focus Strike on to deal even more damage and possibly get a larger damage window.

Underwater

Similar to its first appearance in Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate , Lagiacrus has an underwater combat sequence in Monster Hunter Wilds . This removes all your weapon;s attributes and makes you focus on dodging attacks in the water and interacting with the environment to inflict damage to Lagiacrus. While underwater, you have a dodge motion and the ability to swim up or down. If you hold the left trigger on Xbox or L2 on PlayStation, you will be able to swim freely at varying altitudes in the water. This is the best way to move through the water, as it keeps your head on a swivel to make sure you have eyes on Lagiacrus at all times, and it lets you move more freely.

In this section, there are two rock structures that you can bring down on Lagiacrus. The first one can be brought down as soon as you enter the water if you are quick enough. Doing so will leave Lagiacrus in a stunned state. The second one can be found behind your entry point in the corner.

Players can use their grapple hook to attach onto the monster, similarly to how they would attach to a wound. From there, you can do light attacks with your knife or a weapon attack that takes longer to complete, but deals more damage. Wounds can still be inflicted underwater, so attaching yourself to Lagiacrus whenever you see one can stun it at any time. The monster will also create a temporary wound after doing its projectile attack, similarly to the one it does on land.

If you inflict enough damage to Lagiacrus while underwater, the player who deals the final blow will be put into an animated sequence that unleashes one final attack on the monster. If it is done on the left-hand side of the underwater area, you will send it propelled into a spikey structure that deals even more damage and sends Lagiacrus back up to the surface in a stunned state. This leaves it wide open to any attacks. If this animated sequence is done anywhere else underwater, it will just do some initial damage and send Lagiacrus back to the surface. If you do not do enough damage to Lagiacrus, it will cause this enormous supernova attack that can even damage players outside the water. If that happens, put as much distance between you and Lagiacrus as possible. Even if that means diving deeper into the water, do not resurface until the attack is over.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: 6 90s Video Game Characters Who Have Evolved
item.description:
Summary

  • Lara Croft transitioned from a sex symbol to a feminist icon, symbolizing change in the gaming industry.
  • Leon Kennedy evolved from a rookie cop to a dependable, sturdy hero due to the events of Resident Evil 2.
  • Zack Fair, Knuckles, Kain - characters from the 90s have evolved into complex, iconic heroes in the gaming world.

It's safe to say that the 1990s had an immense impact on the video game industry, as this landmark decade was responsible for some of the most incredible titles and moments in the history of gaming. In addition to the outstanding games and hardware released, the 90s were also a turning point for characters, as the decade produced some truly fantastic heroes, many of whom have stood the test of time and remain icons in the industry today.

When it comes to characters, however, it's important for them to evolve, as they risk staying stagnant and stuck in the same lane forever. And these characters did that in spades, as many of them were able to evolve well beyond the low-poly polygons that the 90s were known for, into fully realized individuals. These characters have been ranked based on their evolution and who they are today, as well as their overall contribution to the world of video games.

1 Zack Fair

Protect Your Honor, As SOLDIER!

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion
9.0 /10
Released
December 13, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix, Tose
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Engine
Unreal Engine 4
Franchise
Final Fantasy
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
How Long To Beat
14 Hours
PS Plus Availability
Extra & Premium
Powered by

Despite only briefly appearing during a few key scenes of the original Final Fantasy 7 for the PS1 in 1997, Zack Fair has slowly but surely emerged as one of the franchise's most complex, consistently evolving figures. The mysterious, black-haired figure that first showed up during one of FF7 's numerous flashbacks would go on to define the Compilation of Final Fantasy 7 and serve as one of the most outstanding heroes in the continuously expanding universe of Gaia.

Zack's first appearance is steeped in intrigue, but as the layers were peeled back and players saw him for what he truly was, he evolved from a catalyst for Cloud's story into one of the most compelling characters in the FF7 universe. His noble sacrifice in the original FF7 , as well as his incredible role during the finale of Final Fantasy 7 Remake and Rebirth , are simply outstanding, while his solo effort during the events of Crisis Core further solidifies him as one of the most complicated heroes in video games.

2 Knuckles

The Stoic Echinda Has Evolved Into One Of Gaming's Greatest Anti-Heroes

Sonic Origins Plus
7.5 /10
Released
June 23, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Sega
Publisher(s)
Sega
Engine
Retro Engine
Franchise
Sonic
Number of Players
1-2
Split Screen Orientation
N/A (Shared Screen)
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Local Co-Op Support
1-2 Players
Powered by

After first appearing during the chaotic opening moments of Sonic the Hedgehog 3 , Knuckles the Echidna is initially presented as an antagonist who stands in opposition to the lightning-fast blue hedgehog. But as the game progresses, players begin to fully understand exactly who Knuckles is, and his alliance with Sonic and the rest of the crew to resist Dr. Robotnik formed one of gaming's most iconic partnerships over the decades.

As Knuckles began to evolve over the years, he grew into one of gaming's most fantastic anti-heroes, as his methodology and personality stand in sharp contrast to Sonic. His ongoing friendship with Amy Rose has also grounded him, creating a character that feels much more honest and natural. Knuckles is a charismatic, battle-tested warrior who has changed quite a bit from his first appearance in Sonic 3 , but has evolved into one of the franchise's most endearing figures.

3 Jill Valentine

The Raccoon City Survivor Is One Of Gaming's Most Iconic Heroines

Resident Evil 3
7 /10
8.3 /10
Released
April 3, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language

Capcom

Resident Evil
Steam Deck Compatibility

PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating

How Long To Beat

X|S Optimized
Yes
File Size Xbox Series
23 GB (February 2024)
PS Plus Availability
Extra & Premium
Powered by

As Jill Valentine creeps through the ominous halls of the Spencer Mansion during the first Resident Evil game, the historic PS1 survival horror game that launched in 1996, her descent into madness takes a massive toll on her. Although she manages to survive the nightmare spawned by Albert Wesker and Umbrella, she leaves the mansion forever changed, which would echo loudly throughout both the franchise and Jill's subsequent appearances.

When Jill returns during the events of Resident Evil 3: Nemesis , she has evolved from the woman who barely escaped a crumbling mansion with her life into a hardened warrior. Her time with S.T.A.R.S. and the horrors of the Spencer Mansion have changed her, and Jill's hard times continue, as her desperate quest to flee a doomed Raccoon City is hampered at every turn by a killing machine known as Nemesis. Jill Valentine has gone through a lot, and with her rumored return for the upcoming Resident Evil: Requiem in 2026, this iconic survival horror heroine may not be done just yet.

4 Kain

The Coin Landed On Its Edge

Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1 & 2 Remastered
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Aspyr, Crystal Dynamics
Publisher(s)
Aspyr
Number of Players
1
Steam Deck Compatibility
Unknown
PC Release Date
December 10, 2024
Xbox Series X|S Release Date
December 10, 2024
PS5 Release Date
December 10, 2024
Nintendo Switch Release Date
December 10, 2024
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
X|S Optimized
Yes
File Size Xbox Series
330.09 MB
Powered by

In terms of video game vampires, there may not be one more well-known or beloved than Kain, the charismatic on-again, off-again protagonist of the Legacy of Kain franchise. First appearing in Blood Omen: Legacy of Kain for the PS1, he has slowly transformed from a power-mad force of nature into a complex, multilayered anti-hero that is at odds both with his own doomed fate and the uneasy alliance with his former friend Raziel.

Both men spend the entirety of the Legacy of Kain series in a constant, never-ending struggle with the tides of fate and their destined end points. Kain's introduction as a noble who becomes a vampire is just the start of his journey, as he teeters the line between all-out villain and a pawn to the destiny that shackles him. Kain feels like a character from classic literature, a man steeped in centuries of fictional history that has shaped him into one of gaming's most complex anti-heroes.

5 Leon Kennedy

From Rookie To Survivor, Leon Is Resident Evil's Most Relatable Hero

Resident Evil 4
9 /10
62
9.5 /10
Released
March 24, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Publisher(s)
Capcom
Engine
RE Engine
Franchise
Resident Evil
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
How Long To Beat
16 Hours
PS Plus Availability
N/A
Powered by

The harrowing events of Resident Evil 2 have shaped Capcom's survival horror franchise more than any other entry, as the destruction of Raccoon City created a sense of scale and despair that defined the series moving forward. And right at the heart of the city's apocalyptic endgame is Leon Kennedy, a rookie cop who couldn't have picked a worse time for his first day on the job, as he's thrown right into the fire alongside Claire Redfield.

After witnessing the cataclysmic end of Raccoon City, Leon found himself in a perilous state, where his knowledge of Umbrella's wrongdoings put him into even more dangerous situations moving forward. Forged by the dramatic events that changed the world of Resident Evil , Leon was elevated from a rookie cop having a bad day into one of gaming's most dependable, sturdy heroes. His sense of humor, charisma, and unrelenting compassion are all incredibly admirable traits, and they were all born from his legendary first appearance in 1998.

6 Lara Croft

A Feminist Icon And Gaming's Greatest Heroine

Shadow of the Tomb Raider
8 /10
6.7 /10
Released
September 14, 2018

If there's any video game character that defines the 1990s, it's Lara Croft. The star of the Tomb Raider franchise was one of the biggest stars of the decade, as Lara graced video games, magazine covers, blockbuster feature films, and comic books. But while Lara may have been awkwardly defined as a sex symbol in the early days, Lara's best days were ahead of her, as she would ascend beyond that to become gaming's most prominent feminist icon and a symbol for change in the industry.

Evolving beyond the snarky adventurer into something more truthful, Lara would find her place as a strong-willed, independent hero who was driven by curiosity and the unexplained. During the Survivor Trilogy, Lara Croft would become the woman she was destined to be, showcasing just how far she had come in nearly three decades. Lara's transformation into one of the industry's most legendary female heroes is a fascinating one, and one that has seen her go through numerous ups and downs to finally emerge as the in-depth examination of heroism that she has become. Lara is set to return to video games in an upcoming Tomb Raider game developed by Crystal Dynamics.
